com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client

Class ChartObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.HasListeners
        • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.ChartObject

  • public class ChartObject
extends HasListeners
    Represents a generic chart javascript object with all common methods. Each chart implementation adds their own specific methods.

      • clearChart

        public final void clearChart()
        Clears the chart, and releases all of its allocated resources.

      • collapse

        public final void collapse(int row,
            boolean collapsed)
        Collapses or expands the node on an OrgChart.
        Parameters:
        row - index of the row to expand or collapse.
        collapsed - whether to collapse or expand the row, where true means collapse.

      • computeDiff

        public final DataSource computeDiff(DataSource oldData,
                     DataSource newData)
        Create a diff chart with two datasets to generate a third dataset representing the diff.
        Parameters:
        oldData - a first dataset
        newData - a second dataset
        Returns:
        a third dataset representing the diff

      • draw

        public final void draw(DataSource data)
        Draws the visualization on the page. Behind the scenes this can be fetching a graphic from a server or creating the graphic on the page using the linked visualization code. You should call this method every time the data or options change. The object should be drawn inside the DOM element passed into the constructor.
        Parameters:
        data - tipically a DataTable or DataView holding the data to use to draw the chart.
        See Also:
        draw() API reference

      • draw

        public final void draw(DataSource data,
        Options options)
        Draws the visualization on the page. Behind the scenes this can be fetching a graphic from a server or creating the graphic on the page using the linked visualization code. You should call this method every time the data or options change. The object should be drawn inside the DOM element passed into the constructor.
        Parameters:
        data - a DataTable or DataView holding the data to use to draw the chart.
        options - A map of name/value pairs of custom options.
        See Also:
        draw API reference

      • getChartLayoutInterface

        public final ChartLayoutInterface getChartLayoutInterface()
        Returns an object containing information about the onscreen placement of the chart and its elements.
        Call this after the chart is drawn.
        Returns:
        a ChartLayoutInterface

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger getChildrenIndexes(int row)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getImageURI

        public final String getImageURI()
        Returns the chart serialized as an image URI.
        Call this after the chart is drawn.
        Returns:
        a serialized image URI
        See Also:
        Printing PNG Charts

      • getMaxPossibleDepth

        public final int getMaxPossibleDepth()
        Currently only applies to TreeMap.
        Returns the maximum possible depth for the current view.
        Returns:
        the maximum possible depth

      • getSelection

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<Selection> getSelection()
        This is optionally exposed by visualizations that want to let you access the currently selected data in the graphic.
        Returns an array of selected objects, each one describing a data element in the underlying table used to create the visualization (a DataView or a DataTable). Each object has properties row and/or column, with the index of the row and/or column of the selected item in the underlying DataTable. If the row property is null, then the selection is a column; if the column property is null, then the selection is a row; if both are non-null, then it is a specific data item. You can call one of the DataTable.getValue() methods to get the value of the selected item. The retrieved array can be passed into setSelection(JsArray).
        Returns:
        an array of selected objects
        See Also:
        getSelection API reference

      • getSortInfo

        public final TableSortInfo getSortInfo()
        Call this method to retrieve information about the current sort state of a table that has been sorted (typically by the user, who has clicked on a column heading to sort the rows by a specific column). If you have disabled sorting, this method will not work. If you have not sorted data in code, or the user has not sorted data by selecting code, the default sort values will be returned.
        Returns:
        information about the current sort state

      • getVisibleChartRange

        public final DateRange getVisibleChartRange()
        Currently only applies to AnnotationChart.
        Returns an object with start and end properties, which each one of them is a Date object, representing the current time selection.
        Returns:
        an object with start and end

      • goUpAndDraw

        public final void goUpAndDraw()
        Currently only applies to TreeMap.
        Move up the tree by one level and redraw it. Does not throw an error if the node is the root node. This is fired automatically when the user right-clicks a node.

      • hideDataColumns

        public final void hideDataColumns(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger columnIndexes)
        Currently only applies to AnnotationChart.
        Hides the specified data series from the chart. Accepts one parameter which can be a number or an array of numbers, in which 0 refers to the first data series, and so on.
        Parameters:
        columnIndexes -

      • setSelection

        public final void setSelection(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<Selection> selection)
        Selects a data entry in the visualization—for example, a point in an area chart, or a bar in a bar chart. When this method is called, the visualization should visually indicate what the new selection is. The implementation of setSelection() should not fire a "select" event. Visualizations may ignore part of the selection. For example, a table that can show only selected rows may ignore cell or column elements in its setSelection() implementation, or it can select the entire row. Every time this method is called, all selected items are deselected, and the new selection list passed in should be applied. There is no explicit way to deselect individual items; to deselect individual items, call setSelection() with the items to remain selected; to deselect all elements, call setSelection(), setSelection(null), or setSelection([]).
        Parameters:
        selection - an array of objects, each with a numeric row and/or column property
        See Also:
        setSelection API reference

      • setVisibleChartRange

        public final void setVisibleChartRange(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsDate start,
                        com.google.gwt.core.client.JsDate end)
        Currently only applies to AnnotationChart.
        Sets the visible range (zoom) to the specified range. Accepts two parameters of type Date that represent the first and last times of the wanted selected visible range.
        Parameters:
        start - set to null to include everything from the earliest date to end
        end - set to null to include everything from start to the last date

      • showDataColumns

        public final void showDataColumns(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger columnIndexes)
        Currently only applies to AnnotationChart.
        Shows the specified data series from the chart, after they were hidden using hideDataColumns method. Accepts one parameter which can be a number or an array of numbers, in which 0 refers to the first data series, and so on.
        Parameters:
        columnIndexes -
